confession.seduction_date: 10 years earlier (when husband wanted to beat her)
confession.seduction_context: Returning from veillée when she found man in black outside her door, who said she was sad but if she would serve him he would make her rich. She cried out 'Jesus Maria' and he left, but she kept the 'verge' (wand) he gave her
sabbat_activities: dancing (though she claimed not to participate)

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same evening (fell ill), died next day

testimony.threat_quote: par la nom dieu sy l'on me prenoit j'en accuserois de sy grosses que l'on me lascheroit pour l'amour d'elles (by God's name if I were taken I would accuse such important people that they would release me for love of them)

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot (but witness did not suspect anyone)

testimony.threat_quote: laisse le dire ne t'en donne poinct de peine je me soucye bien que l'on dict je ne seray jamais fille de prebtre sy je ne le suys (let them talk, don't worry about it, I don't care what they say, I will never be a priest's daughter if I'm not already)
he would have her burned whatever it cost, to which she replied that he should keep quiet and his son would not die

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: immediate (sudden pain in stomach after she touched his hat)

witnesses.name: François Vieville
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: former resident of Preny, involved in slander

testimony.quarrel_subject: slander about accused (claimed she slept with Claude Landreville and Jean de Maye)

witnesses.name: Jeanne veuve Claudin Millot dit Champel
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: lived in same house as first witness

timeline.subject: Jeanne veuve Claudin Millot dit Champel
Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot
timeline.details: Began to confess to pact with devil, sabbat attendance

timeline.subject: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot
timeline.details: Rémy requests question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot
timeline.details: Post-torture interrogation, full confession to multiple maleficia

timeline.subject: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot
timeline.details: Tortured (method unspecified), confessed to additional deaths

timeline.subject: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

accomplices_named.name: Babon dite Mantonsotte, wife of Willaume laboureur
accomplices_named.context: Accused saw her at sabbat on way back to Preny when her mask slipped. Maintained charge at confrontation. Also claimed Babon was so frightened of arrest she would have killed herself but for her husband's intervention.

accomplices_named.name: la Bonne, femme Mengeot Bricholat
accomplices_named.context: Accused claimed to have recognized her at sabbat by her clothing. Maintained charge at confrontation.

accomplices_named.name: Jeannotte, wife of Didier Pierron marchal
accomplices_named.context: Accused provided suspicious testimony about her behavior (getting up 2 hours before dawn at St Nicolas, pretending to empty chamber pot that was empty, mother chased from Jaulny for witchcraft suspicion, wishing ill on Sieur de Bonnigny). Did not definitively accuse her as witch.

prior_accusations.accuser_name: Cathin, previously wife of Laurent Woirion, now wife of Michiel Perrin
prior_accusations.context: Denounced Chrestaille for killing her child. This led to several villages refusing to let Chrestaille reside there.

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot
notable_quotes.french: je ne m'ayme poinct avec mon marit
notable_quotes.english: I don't love myself with my husband / I am not happy with my husband
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why she was sad when other women were imprisoned for witchcraft

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot
notable_quotes.french: par la nom dieu sy l'on me prenoit j'en accuserois de sy grosses que l'on me lascheroit pour l'amour d'elles
notable_quotes.english: by God's name if I were taken I would accuse such important people that they would release me for love of them
notable_quotes.context: Told to Jeanne Claudin when discussing arrest of someone from Champel

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot (corrected version)
notable_quotes.french: par la mort dieu sy je l'estois et j'en scavois je les accuserois fussent mes pere et mere
notable_quotes.english: by death of God if I were [a witch] and I knew [others] I would accuse them even if they were my father and mother
notable_quotes.context: Her version of what she said to Jeanne Claudin during interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbe Wathot
notable_quotes.french: laisse le dire ne t'en donne poinct de peine je me soucye bien que l'on dict je ne seray jamais fille de prebtre sy je ne le suys
notable_quotes.english: let them talk, don't worry about it, I don't care what they say, I will never be a priest's daughter if I'm not already
notable_quotes.context: Chrestaille's response when Barbe told her people suspected her of witchcraft

notable_quotes.speaker: Lambert Jean Lambert (threat to Chrestaille)
notable_quotes.english: he would have her burned whatever it cost
notable_quotes.context: Threatened Chrestaille when his son was ill

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot (response to Lambert)
notable_quotes.english: he should keep quiet and his son would not die

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeannotte, wife of Didier Pierron
notable_quotes.english: wished his horses were in the belly of a wolf
notable_quotes.context: After Sieur de Bonnigny beat her husband for not shoeing horses properly

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeannotte, wife of Didier Pierron
notable_quotes.context: When someone said it was 'grand dommaige' that a woman from Sieur de Bonnigny's house died, she wished it were 'a bigger one' meaning the Sieur himself

relationships.evidence_text: married Jean Wathot some 20 years earlier
daughter of Fleurent Harmant le Cuyr
when Chrestaille was her neighbour at Preny
Had been her servant for 5 years

she and her daughter shared a bed with Jeannotte
her daughter Margueritte, who was wife of Gerard Molleur

economic_context.details: Accused sold grain and was financially able to pay for masses. Minor quarrels over fruit, milling, salt lending, and inheritance mentioned.

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill same evening, died next day
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: touched child and admired 'couralz' (bracelets) on arms
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: same evening (fell ill), died next day

harms_catalog.victim_name: 2 other pigs belonging to Barbe Wathot
Claude, son of Lambert Jean Lambert
harms_catalog.harm_description: sudden pain in stomach, thought he was dying
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: touched his hat lightly on way to sprinkle holy water on deceased Colas Golsey

harms_catalog.victim_name: child aged 6 of Claudotte femme Laurent Mathiot

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: slander - François spread story that she slept with Claude Landreville and Jean de Maye

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot (per her confession)
Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot (per her confession under torture)

harms_catalog.victim_name: Margueritte wife of Gerard Molleur (daughter of Chrestaille femme Anthoine Fournier)
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot (per her confession under torture)

harms_catalog.victim_name: Catherine femme Martin Melnie, echevin in the justice of Preny
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Chrestaille femme Jean Wathot (per her confession under torture)

material_culture.context: worn by small child on arms, admired by Chrestaille before child became ill
refused to lend salt to Chrestaille, child became ill same evening
given by devil Mre Hanry to avenge herself on enemies, used with yellow powder for maleficia
given by devil, rubbed on wand to commit maleficia
given by devil but later vanished
given by devil, she threw on fire
used as healing remedy - obtained from Chrestaille's servant by François Vieville on advice of devineresse
given by Chrestaille to Magot for healing
Jeannotte pretended to empty it but it was empty - suspicious behavior

spatial_references.context: main location of trial, residence of accused and most witnesses
current residence of first witness Cathin
la Trougnotte of Paigny was imprisoned for witchcraft
someone from Champel was brought for witchcraft charge
sabbat location at 6 in the morning
where Chrestaille stayed on way back from pilgrimage to St Cesar
Jeannotte's mother was chased out on suspicion of witchcraft
where Chrestaille was cutting thistles and weeds among grain when devil visited her second time
devil made witches pass over the gates to go to assemblies

animal_predation: wolf took pig belonging to Barbe Wathot
Jeannotte wished Sieur de Bonnigny's horses were in belly of wolf
religious_calendar_references: Whitsun (when pilgrimage to St Cesar occurred)

legal_context.redress_outcome: unable to take action against Lambert Jean Lambert since she had no witnesses to his threat

hearsay_chains.reporter: Jeanne veuve Claudin Millot dit Champel
hearsay_chains.content: Cathin had supposed child was bewitched by Tante Parrotte or by accused
Jeannotte's mother had been chased out of Jaulny on suspicion of witchcraft

emotional_state_notes: sadder than usual when other witches were imprisoned
maintained accusations against accomplices despite vigorous denials at confrontation

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Jeanne veuve Claudin Millet should be heard; she had seen body of child and a mark on thigh which suggested that Cathin had put elbow on it during sleep (i.e., overlaying rather than witchcraft)
unable to take action against Lambert Jean Lambert since she had no witnesses to his threat
had not quarrelled with Magot, she had taken her 'laitage' at request of Jeanne Claudin

third_parties.name: Tante Parrotte of Preny
third_parties.context: imprisoned on charge of witchcraft, which made Chrestaille sad. Cathin thought Tante Parrotte might have bewitched her child for refusing alms.

third_parties.name: la Trougnotte of Paigny
third_parties.context: imprisoned for witchcraft, which made Chrestaille sad

third_parties.name: le vieux Colas Golsey
third_parties.context: died at Easter 10 years earlier; people were on way to sprinkle holy water on him when incident with Claude occurred

third_parties.name: devineresse
third_parties.context: advised François to get bread and salt from house of person he suspected, then make pilgrimage

third_parties.name: Claude Landreville
third_parties.context: François Vieville spread story that Chrestaille slept with him

third_parties.name: Jean de Maye
third_parties.context: François Vieville spread story that Chrestaille slept with him

third_parties.name: Sieur de Bonnigny
third_parties.context: Chrestaille killed 2 of his animals with wand; he beat Jeannotte's husband for not shoeing horses properly

third_parties.name: sieur capittaine
third_parties.context: had long been threatening to take Chrestaille as a witch

third_parties.name: Jeannotte's mother
third_parties.context: chased out of Jaulny on suspicion of witchcraft

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial record is complete and detailed. Includes 8 witnesses, multiple interrogations, torture, confession under torture, naming of accomplices, and death sentence. Some confusion around exact wording of Chrestaille's quote to Jeanne Claudin - two versions provided. Document dated from deposition on 6 April 1597 for witness 8 appears to be out of chronological sequence. Methods of torture not specified beyond 'question ordinaire et extraordinaire'. Chrestaille confessed to pact with devil named Mre Hanry, attending sabbats, and causing multiple deaths and illnesses through use of magical wand and yellow powder.
